dcterms:creator: Christiane Fellbaum
dcterms:description: WordNet is a lexical database for the English language that groups words into sets of synonyms called synsets, providing short definitions and usage examples, and records the various semantic relations between these synonym sets.
dcterms:title: WordNet

dcterms:creator: Daniela Gerz

dcterms:description: SimVerb3500 is a large-scale evaluation set designed to assess the similarity of verbs, providing a benchmark for evaluating models of verb similarity.
dcterms:title: SimVerb3500

dcterms:creator: Elia Bruni
Nam-Khanh Tran
Marco Baroni
dcterms:description: MEN is a dataset for evaluating word embeddings based on human judgments of word similarity, providing a benchmark for assessing the quality of word vector representations.
dcterms:title: MEN

dcterms:creator: Felix Hill
Roi Reichart
Anna Korhonen
dcterms:description: SimLex999 is a dataset designed to evaluate semantic models based on genuine similarity estimation, providing a benchmark for assessing the quality of word embeddings.
dcterms:title: SimLex999

dcterms:creator: Herbert Rubenstein
John B Goodenough
dcterms:description: RG is a dataset that provides contextual correlates of synonymy, offering a benchmark for evaluating word similarity based on human judgments.
dcterms:title: RG

dcterms:creator: Lev Finkelstein
Evgeniy Gabrilovich
Yossi Matias
Ehud Rivlin
Zach Solan
Gadi Wolfman
Eytan Ruppin
dcterms:description: WS353 is a dataset for evaluating word similarity based on human judgments, providing a benchmark for assessing the quality of word embeddings.
dcterms:title: WS353

dcterms:creator: Eric H. Huang
Richard Socher
Christopher D. Manning
Andrew Y. Ng
dcterms:description: SCWS is a dataset designed to evaluate word embeddings based on their ability to capture semantic similarity and relatedness, providing a benchmark for assessing the quality of word vector representations.
dcterms:title: SCWS

dcterms:creator: Guy Halawi
Gideon Dror
Evgeniy Gabrilovich
Yehuda Koren
dcterms:description: MTurk is a dataset for learning word relatedness using human judgments, providing a benchmark for evaluating the quality of word embeddings.
dcterms:title: MTurk
